        #include <stdio.h>

        // We need to represent the graph.

        int *next_edge; // next edge in the linked list for a node
        int *head; // head[i] is the first edge index for node i
        int edge_count = 0;

        void add_edge(int u, int v) {
            // add edge u->v
            adj[edge_count] = v;
            next_edge[edge_count] = head[u];
            head[u] = edge_count++;
        }

        int maxMatching(int v, int p) {
            int a = 0;
            int o = 0;
            for (int idx = head[v]; idx != -1; idx = next_edge[idx]) {
                int w = adj[idx];
                if (w == p) continue;
                int r = maxMatching(w, v);
                a += r / 2;
                o += r % 2;
            }
            return 2 * a + (o>0?1:0) + 1; // note: Math.min(1, o) is 1 if o>0, else 0.
        }

            int *next_edge = (int*)malloc(2 * (n-1) * sizeof(int));
            int edge_count = 0;

            // Function to add edge
            #define add_edge(u, v) do { \
                adj[edge_count] = (v); \
                next_edge[edge_count] = head[(u)]; \
                head[(u)] = edge_count++; \
            } while(0)

            for (int i = 0; i < n-1; i++) {
                int a, b;
                scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);
                a--; b--;
                add_edge(a, b);
                add_edge(b, a);
            }

            // If n==1? then we skip the BFS? but n>=2.

            // Arrays for BFS: parent, child_count, unprocessed_children: VLA
            int parent[n];
            int child_count[n];
            int unprocessed_children[n];
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
                parent[i] = -1;
                child_count[i] = 0;
            }

            // BFS queue: dynamic allocation
            int *queue_bfs = (int*)malloc(n * sizeof(int));
            int front_bfs = 0, rear_bfs = 0;
            queue_bfs[rear_bfs++] = 0;
            parent[0] = -1;

            while (front_bfs < rear_bfs) {
                int v = queue_bfs[front_bfs++];
                for (int idx = head[v]; idx != -1; idx = next_edge[idx]) {
                    int w = adj[idx];
                    if (w == parent[v]) continue;
                    parent[w] = v;
                    queue_bfs[rear_bfs++] = w;
                    child_count[v]++; // v has a child w
                }
            }

            // unprocessed_children = copy of child_count
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
                unprocessed_children[i] = child_count[i];
            }

            // Queue for processing from leaves to root
            int *queue_proc = (int*)malloc(n * sizeof(int));
            int front_proc = 0, rear_proc = 0;
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
                if (unprocessed_children[i] == 0) {
                    queue_proc[rear_proc++] = i;
                }
            }

            int *res_arr = (int*)malloc(n * sizeof(int));

            while (front_proc < rear_proc) {
                int v = queue_proc[front_proc++];
                int a = 0;
                int o = 0;
                // Traverse neighbors (children) of v
                for (int idx = head[v]; idx != -1; idx = next_edge[idx]) {
                    int w = adj[idx];
                    if (w == parent[v]) continue; // skip parent
                    // w is a child -> must have been processed
                    int r = res_arr[w];
                    a += r / 2;
                    o += r % 2;
                }
                res_arr[v] = 2 * a + (o>0?1:0) + 1;

                // Update parent's unprocessed count
                int par = parent[v];
                if (par != -1) {
                    unprocessed_children[par]--;
                    if (unprocessed_children[par] == 0) {
                        queue_proc[rear_proc++] = par;
                    }
                }
            }

            int res = res_arr[0];
            int m = res / 2;
            char *ans1;
            if (2 * m == n) {
                ans1 = "Second";
            } else {
                ans1 = "First";
            }

            int foundA = 0, foundB = 0;
            for (int i = 0; ans1[i]; i++) {
                if (ans1[i]=='A') foundA=1;
                if (ans1[i]=='B') foundB=1;
            }
            if (foundA && foundB) {
                printf("Yes\n");
            } else {
                printf("No\n");
            }

            // Free allocated memory
            free(head);
            free(adj);
            free(next_edge);
            free(queue_bfs);
            free(queue_proc);
            free(res_arr);

            return 0;
        }
